input: Firstly, there are more multinational companies that need people to speak other languages, so that means that the people who know to speak foreign language have more opportunities to get a job in important companies, or will have more chances of being promoted.
target: Firstly, there are more multinational companies that need people to speak other languages, so that means that people who know how to speak a foreign language have more opportunities to get a job in big companies, or will have more chances of being promoted.

target: On the other hand, there are more benefits . For example, if you want to travel to another country, it is very useful to know a different language, because you can understand everything without complications.

input: Finally, learning another language gives the learner the ability to step inside the mind and context of that other culture.
target: Finally, learning another language gives the learner the ability to step inside the mind and context of that other culture.

input: Today globalization is bringing the world more close, that means that there are more possibilities to have contact with the other cultures, for example in literature, poetry, films, TV programs, music or some other aspect of the culture.
target: Today, globalization is bringing the world closer together . That means that there are more possibilities to have contact with other cultures, for example through literature, poetry, films, TV programs, music or some other aspect of the culture.

input: On balance, learning foreign languages is very positive on different aspect, so if you have the positivity of learning a new language do it, because it will bring you many benefits.

input: Cycling to school, to work or to do any other activity it is not a common habit in Spain.
target: Cycling to school, to work or to do any other activity is not a common habit in Spain.

input: However, the government and the local councils of big cities such as Madrid or Valencia, are trying their best to promote this movement because they consider it a way of development.
target: However, the government and the local councils of big cities such as Madrid or Valencia are trying their best to promote this movement because they consider it a way of developing.

input: On the one hand, there are many benefits of cycling.
target: On the one hand, there are many benefits to cycling.

target: Firstly, it reduces traffic jams, noise and pollution, as well as lowering CO2 emissions.

target: Furthermore, it turns out to be the quickest mode of transport.

target: On the other hand, there are some issues such as the increase of danger on the roads.

target: Statistically, cycling is generally considered to be more dangerous than travelling by car.

target: Getting wet when it rains, having to make a lot of effort to cycle into a strong wind, freezing weather or having to keep drinking during hot weather.

target: From my point of view, cycling contributes to improving community spirit and it is possible to look for solutions to face the disadvantages of this activity.

input: No one can deny that travelling by car is much more convenient than by public transport.
target: No one can deny that travelling by car is much more convenient than travelling by public transport.

input: For example, people taking car do not need to spend time waiting for the bus or subway.
target: For example, people taking their car do not need to spend time waiting for the bus or subway.

input: And this undesirable time might be not so short during holidays, due to less frequent schedule.
target: And this undesirable waiting time might not be so short during holidays, due to less frequent schedules.

input: Also, we can drive a car to any place where the public transport perhaps is not able not reach.
target: Also, we can drive a car to any place where the public transport is perhaps not able to reach.

input: When the bus is crowded, we have to stand, making us more exhausting especially for a long distance.
target: When the bus is crowded, we have to stand, making us more exhausted, especially over a long distance.

input: Even though cars could provide us with so many advantages mentioned above, advantages of travelling by public transport should not be neglected.
target: Even though cars can provide us with so many advantages mentioned above, the advantages of travelling by public transport should not be ignored.

input: First, public transport is good for the environment compared to private car.
target: First, public transport is good for the environment compared to private cars.

input: As we all know, the more public transport passengers use, the less car exhausts are emitted per person.
target: As we all know, the more passengers use public transport, the less car exhaust is emitted per person.

input: Recently, several studies have shown evidences that there is a strong relation between car exhausts and lung cancers.
target: Recently, several studies have shown evidence that there is a strong relationship between car exhaust and lung cancer.

input: In other words, public transport plays an important role in protecting human beings from suffering of diseases and saving life.
target: In other words, public transport plays an important role in protecting human beings from suffering diseases and saves lives.

input: Second, public transport saves city spaces.
target: Second, public transport saves city space.

target: As more and more people choose to live in cities, nowadays, our cities are becoming larger and more crowded.

input: Correspondingly, the space for each person becomes more limited than before.
target: Correspondingly, the space for each person is becoming more limited than before.

input: Provided that every citizen owns a car and use it rather than public transport for every travelling chance, I suppose that our streets would become a parking place and everyone would spend more time in congesting.
target: If every citizen owns a car and uses it rather than public transport for every travelling opportunity, I suppose that our streets will become a car park and everyone will spend more time in congestion.

input: Last but not the least, public transport allows people to do other things which is impossible when driving.
target: Last but not least, public transport allows people to do other things which are impossible when driving.

input: The drivers have to continuously pay attention to surroundings, resulting in a tense spirit.
target: Drivers have to continuously pay attention to surroundings, resulting in a tense mood.

input: Nowadays, public transport has become a major topic.
target: Nowadays, public transport has become a major topic.

input: The idea of leaving public transportation aside is widely supported in developed countries, but this idea is rejected in developing countries, like the one I live in.
target: The idea of abandoning public transportation is widely supported in developed countries, but this idea is rejected in developing countries, like the one I live in.

input: As a matter of fact, car ownership have increased over the last decades reducing the amount of people using public transport.
target: As a matter of fact, car ownership has increased over the last decades, reducing the number of people using public transport.

input: The possibility of travelling in their own cars is much more convenient than going by a bus full of people or even worse, the idea of wasting time in a long queue.
target: The possibility of travelling in their own cars is much more convenient than travelling in a bus full of people or, even worse, the idea of wasting time in a long queue.

input: Nevertheless, you have another side to this reality.
target: Nevertheless, there is another side to this reality.

input: There are people who cannot afford to have their own cars or maybe they can afford to travel by any other means of transportation than the ones provided by the local government.
target: There are people who cannot afford to have their own cars or maybe they can afford to travel by any other means of transportation than the ones provided by the local government.

input: There are countries where gas is so expensive that people choose to pay the bus fee rather than paying for a full tank.
target: There are countries where gas is so expensive that people choose to pay the bus fare rather than pay for a full tank.

input: Similarly, people in countries with less income turn to these services because it is a way to reduce their overall expenses.
target: Similarly, people in countries with a lower income turn to these services because it is a way to reduce their overall expenses.

input: To conclude, the future of public transport will depend on the usage people give it.
target: To conclude, the future of public transport will depend on the usage people make of it.

input: There will be countries in which there will be no need for it, and in others where they will need it as long as their economy needs it.
target: There will be countries in which there will be no need for it, and others where they will need it as long as their economy needs it.

input: People need easy, fast and cheap solutions.
target: People need easy, fast and cheap solutions.

input: In general, using a car is easier then taking a train or a bus.
target: In general, using a car is easier then taking a train or a bus.

input: It's just near your house or your office.
target: It's just near your house or your office.

input: You don't have to go to a station by walking, carrying weights, or suffering because of the rain or the snow.
target: You don't have to go to a station on foot, carrying bags, or suffering because of the rain or the snow.

input: But if you are sleepy, tired, bored, or simply you don't like to drive, you can find easier to take a public transport.
target: But if you are sleepy, tired, bored, or you simply don't like to drive, you could find it easier to take public transport.

input: And also more enjoyable: you can relax listening to the music and looking around, or reading newspapers and books.
target: And also more enjoyable: you can relax, listening to music and looking around, or reading newspapers and books.

input: Is the car faster then public transport?
target: Is the car faster than public transport?

input: It depends.
target: It depends.

input: The traffic can affect cars and buses at the same level.
target: The traffic can affect cars and buses to the same extent.

input: Sometimes cars are faster then buses, sometimes buses are faster.
target: Sometimes cars are faster than buses; sometimes buses are faster.

input: Speed trains are always faster then cars.
target: Fast trains are always faster than cars.

input: Speaking about money? Travelling by car seems cheaper than public transport.
target: Speaking about money, travelling by car seems cheaper than public transport.

input: But, if we consider all the expenses (buying the car, paying the insurance, etc .), maybe cars are not so cheap.
target: But, if we consider all the expenses (buying the car, paying for the insurance, etc .), maybe cars are not so cheap.

input: In fact, in every aspect there are pros and cons.
target: In fact, in every aspect there are pros and cons.

input: What about the environment and the quality of life in the cities?
target: What about the environment and the quality of life in the cities?

input: Public transport is absolutely better.
target: Public transport is definitely better.

input: So, even if travelling by car can be more convenient at a personal level, public transport has to be preferred by good citizens and strongly supported by governments.
target: So, even if travelling by car can be more convenient at a personal level, public transport should be preferred by good citizens and strongly supported by governments.

target: All I was asked to do the rest of the time was to take phone calls and make coffee for tourists.

target: When you decide what to do, do not hesitate to let me know!

target: I arrived in Mexico City one month ago and I met an old friend from high school, Vicente.

target: We discovered our fascination with food and' The Puerquitour' was born.

target: The first day started on an important date … Taco Day!

target: Tacontento was the place we chose and we really enjoyed alambre al pastor and grilled onions, accompanied by cold beers.

input: Again we ate tacos, but this time they were special.

target: The name of the place is Tacos La Chule and tacos are gourmet there.

target: This means that they have different flavours of tortillas -vanilla, strawberry, chipotle, nopal, and walnut, among others- and salsas -tamarind, guava, mango, guacamole, etc.

target: That day did not end with the tacos . After a walk in Reforma and a long pause in The Independence Angel, we went to a movie theatre to watch the art movie Renoir while we ate crepes.

input: The best places for young people in Dublin
target: The best places for young people in Dublin

input: This report looks at the best places to visit in Dublin for young people from a different country.
target: This report looks at the best places to visit in Dublin for young people from a different country.

input: It is based on a survey of the young people from Whitehall College as well as my own opinion as a permanent resident in the area.
target: It is based on a survey of the young people from Whitehall College as well as my own opinion as a permanent resident in the area.

input: It seems that the majority of those surveyed are of the opinion that the best place to visit for young people would be Temple Bar.
target: It seems that the majority of those surveyed are of the opinion that the best place to visit for young people would be Temple Bar.

input: It offers a wide variety of activities like museums, a cinema, a very large green garden and many pubs to choose from.
target: It offers a wide variety of activities like museums, a cinema, a very large green garden and many pubs to choose from.

input: The Johnnie Fox Pub was highly recommended, it offers an opportunity to listen to traditional music, watch dancers perform and enjoy a nice meal in one place.
target: The Johnnie Fox Pub was highly recommended, it offers an opportunity to listen to traditional music, watch dancers perform and enjoy a nice meal in one place.

input: The Odeon cinema offers a multiple choice of movies in 2D and 3D and a discount for students on Wednesdays.
target: The Odeon cinema offers a wide choice of movies in 2D and 3D and a discount for students on Wednesdays.

input: The Dublin Wax Museum was suggested by many students.
target: The Dublin Wax Museum was suggested by many students.

input: Several people said that National Botanic Garden is the best place for students to meet and spend time outdoors.
target: Several people said that the National Botanic Garden is the best place for students to meet and spend time outdoors.

input: On the whole there are activities to take part in and many places to visit depending on students preferences and finances available to them.
target: On the whole, there are activities to take part in and many places to visit depending on students' preferences and the finances available to them.

input: It is true that people everywhere like watching sports.
target: It is true that people everywhere like watching sports.

input: Sports starts being admired by youth and can imprint a model of behavior on the young's minds.
target: Sports start being admired by young people and can imprint a model of behavior on the minds of the young.

input: In this essay both sides of the position stated above will be analyzed before my own perspective is provided.
target: In this essay, both sides of the position stated above will be analyzed before my own perspective is provided.

input: From one point of view, top athletes are good models to emulate for several reasons.
target: From one point of view, top athletes are good models to emulate for several reasons.

input: Firstly, watching the success of such athletes, teenagers start to desire to be like their idols and to follow professional sports.
target: Firstly, watching the success of such athletes, teenagers start to desire to be like their idols and to follow professional sports.

input: This means they will want to play sports, which is essential for their health.
target: This means they will want to play sports, which is essential for their health.

input: Secondly, doing sports also teaches priceless life lessons, such as discipline and dealing with success and failure.
target: Secondly, doing sports also teaches priceless life lessons, such as discipline and dealing with success and failure.

input: The importance of working hard to achieve goalы and practicing regularly to become good at something are also demonstrated by professional sportsmen.
target: The importance of working hard to achieve goals and practicing regularly to become good at something are also demonstrated by professional sportsmen.

input: This is a good example for youngsters to follow.
target: This is a good example for youngsters to follow.

input: From another perspective, sometimes professional athletes are not good role models.
target: From another perspective, sometimes, professional athletes are not good role models.

input: Firstly, sport has become business.
target: Firstly, sport has become business.

input: Many sports stars are only concerned about money and fame.
target: Many sports stars are only concerned about money and fame.

input: This can lead adolescents to believe that money and fame are an important part of sports instead of learning how to play well and having the fun of the game or the competition.
target: This can lead adolescents to believe that money and fame are an important part of sports instead of learning how to play well and having the fun of the game or the competition.

input: Secondly, there are those athletes who behave disgustingly.
target: Secondly, there are those athletes who behave disgustingly.

input: For example, some take drugs or cheat in order to win at any cost.
target: For example, some take drugs or cheat in order to win at any cost.

input: It goes without saying, that this kind of behavior sends a wrong message to the young.
target: It goes without saying that this kind of behavior sends the wrong message to the young.

input: In conclusion, there are a number of advantages and disadvantages in regard to professional sportsmen as good role models for young people.
target: In conclusion, there are a number of advantages and disadvantages in regard to professional sportsmen as good role models for young people.

input: On balance, I am inclined to believe that professional athletes can be excellent role models for the youth, as long as they represent the positive aspects of playing sports.
target: On balance, I am inclined to believe that professional athletes can be excellent role models for the young, as long as they represent the positive aspects of playing sports.

input: Dickens and the Bronte sisters use the same style: realistic style.
target: Dickens and the Bronte sisters use the same style: realistic style.

input: They are influenced by the surrounding in which they live: Dickens the city of London while the Bronte sisters the natural landscape of the Yorkshire.
target: They are influenced by the surroundings in which they live: Dickens, the city of London, and the Bronte sisters the natural landscape of Yorkshire.

input: Dickens and Charlotte Bronte often use the first person narrator or the point of view of the protagonist of the story.
target: Dickens and Charlotte Bronte often use a first person narrator or the point of view of the protagonist of the story.

input: Their realism is different: in fact Dickens' style is that of sentimental realism in which he mixes pathos and comedy, like characters that tend to be caricatures of the vices and virtues he wish to portray, while the Bronte sisters use realistic style laced with Romantic and Gothic elements, like Byronic male heroes and female protagonists that are psychologically complex.
target: Their realism is different: in fact, Dickens' style is that of sentimental realism, in which he mixes pathos and comedy, like characters that tend to be caricatures of the vices and virtues he wishes to portray, while the Bronte sisters use a realistic style laced with Romantic and Gothic elements, like Byronic male heroes and female protagonists that are psychologically complex.

input: Both lamb consumption and the category labelled beef had a decline trend between 1979 and 2004, although maintained a decrease overall, with lamb consumption falling from a peak of 150 grams per person per week in 1979 down to just over 50 grams per person per week in 2004 and beef consumption falling from around 230 grams per person per week down to just over 120 grams per person per week.

input: Dear Mr. Merrifield:
target: Dear Mr. Merrifield:

input: My name is Dmitry Lavrov.
target: My name is Dmitry Lavrov.

input: I'm a postdoc in Russian Cancer Research Center.
target: I'm a postdoc at the Russian Cancer Research Center.

input: Our lab works along with Alexis Hervieux on his study of arpin.
target: Our lab works along with Alexis Hervieux on his study of arpin.

input: Recently he has visited Moscow and while we've been having conversation I've mentioned that I was looking for the opportunity to work on postdoc position abroad.
target: Recently, he visited Moscow and while we were having a conversation, I mentioned that I was looking for an opportunity to work in a postdoc position abroad.

input: And since my great interest is to develop my skills in microscopy and digital image analysis while working in the field of cell biology Alexis told me to try and contact you.
target: And since my great interest is to develop my skills in microscopy and digital image analysis while working in the field of cell biology, Alexis told me to try contacting you.

input: Our conversation with Alexis and your own publications - all supports the suggestion that working in your lab apparently will provide valuable opportunities to master methodological and research skills.
target: Our conversation with Alexis and your own publications all support the suggestion that working in your lab apparently will provide valuable opportunities to master methodological and research skills.

input: Not to mention the participation in pioneering study.
target: Not to mention the participation in a pioneering study.

input: My own work is dedicated to the study of changes in cell - cell contacts and in actin cytoskeleton that take place during neoplastic transformation of epithelial cells.
target: My own work is dedicated to the study of changes in cell - cell contacts and in the actin cytoskeleton that take place during neoplastic transformation of epithelial cells.

input: Earlier I had a publication in PLoS One with description of dissimilarities in organization and regulation of adherence junctions associated with different types of actin bundles in normal and transformed epithelial cells.
target: Earlier I had a publication in PLoS One with description of dissimilarities in the organization and regulation of adherence junctions associated with different types of actin bundles in normal and transformed epithelial cells.

input: Thereafter I studied accumulation of various actin - binding proteins and actin isoforms within adherence junction in normal and transformed cells.
target: Thereafter, I studied the accumulation of various actin - binding proteins and actin isoforms within adherence junction in normal and transformed cells.

input: On the coarse of this investigation I have obtained some promising results which I'm going to report on the FEBS - EMBO conference which will take place in Paris in the beginning of september.
target: In the course of this investigation, I have obtained some promising results which I'm going to report on at the FEBS - EMBO conference which will take place in Paris at the beginning of September.

input: Also I'm preparing materials for the next publication.
target: Also, I'm preparing materials for the next publication.

input: Yours respectfully,
target: Yours respectfully,

input: Dmitry Lavrov
target: Dmitry Lavrov

input: P.S. There are my CV and a copy of my paper in the attachment.
target: P.S. My CV and a copy of my paper are in the attachment.

target: Lima was founded by Francisco Pizarro in 1535, as " Ciudad de los Reyes ".

input: Lima has a multicultural tradition, then in it coincide a complex mix of racial and ethnic groups like mestizos, European Peruvians which are the second largest group and the minority in Lima includes Aymara and Quechua and Afro - Peruvians.
target: Lima has a multicultural tradition, as in it coincide a complex mix of racial and ethnic groups, like mestizos, European Peruvians, who are the second largest group, and the minority in Lima includes Aymara and Quechua and Afro - Peruvians.

input: Lima is the best example of colonization, immigration, and indigenous influences such as the stay of Pre - Hispanic legacy with architectural monuments, called " Huacas ".

input: The Historic Centre of Lima was declared World Heritage Site in 1988.
target: The Historic Centre of Lima was declared a World Heritage Site in 1988.

input: It is a city that keeps its history through an amazing architecture like balconies, churches like San Francisco Church which has mysterious subterranean catacombs; el Real Felipe which is the last incredible Spanish fortress; through their costumes as well as Carnival, this day you can enjoy this particular, interesting and colorful festival because you use water, paint or talc to wet your family and neighbor; their typical dance called " La Marinera "; also they keep their history through religion where you discover the religious enthusiasm which is represented by la Procesión del Señor de los Milagros; their gastronomy is another extraordinary and wonderful example about their symbols, like Mazamorra Morada, el Pisco Sour (wine), el Ceviche, los Picarones, etc.

Their gastronomy is another extraordinary and wonderful example of their symbols, like Mazamorra Morada, el Pisco Sour (wine), el Ceviche, los Picarones, etc.

input: Lima is a beautiful city of contrast, where you can find a diversity of historical, modern and business places.
target: Lima is a beautiful city of contrast, where you can find a diversity of historical, modern and business places.

input: I have been skiing for most of life and I am very enthusiastic about it.
target: I have been skiing for most of my life and I am very enthusiastic about it.

input: I started when I was six with equipment that was very basic compared to what skiers use these days.
target: I started when I was six with equipment that was very basic compared to what skiers use these days.

input: Every day as soon as I woke up I looked forward to my morning on the slopes.
target: Every day, as soon as I woke up, I looked forward to my morning on the slopes.

input: My parents would take me to a gentle slope with my brother and leave us there for a couple of hours to try skiing on our own.
target: My parents would take me to a gentle slope with my brother and leave us there for a couple of hours to try skiing on our own.

input: The temperature was often several degrees below zero, and you would freeze if you didn't keep moving up and down the slope.
target: The temperature was often several degrees below zero, and you would freeze if you didn't keep moving up and down the slope.

input: My brother showed a natural talent for the sport, but I felt quite uncomfortable and scared.
target: My brother showed a natural talent for the sport, but I felt quite uncomfortable and scared.

input: Little by little I improved my skiing skills and by the time I was a teenager I really started enjoying myself.
target: Little by little, I improved my skiing skills and by the time I was a teenager I really started enjoying myself.

input: Nowadays I have a lot of fun skiing because it gives me the opportunity to be in a wonderful natural environment.
target: Nowadays, I have a lot of fun skiing because it gives me the opportunity to be in a wonderful natural environment.

input: Skiing is a great sport, but I would recommend starting as a child, taking a few lessons with an experienced instructor and using the right equipment.
target: Skiing is a great sport, but I would recommend starting as a child, taking a few lessons with an experienced instructor and using the right equipment.
